definitions.definition: To incite or cause troublesome acts; to encourage ; to instigate .
examples: He was arrested for fomenting a riot; after all, it's bad enough being in a riot but starting one is much worse.
Foreign governments have tried to foment unrest.

definitions.definition: To apply a poultice to; to bathe with a cloth or sponge .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To incite or cause troublesome acts; to encourage ; to instigate .
secondary_definitions: ( medicine , transitive ) To apply a poultice to; to bathe with a cloth or sponge .
